title: Fix hero text readability and remove distracting scroll animation

requirements.text: Improve text readability in the hero section by strengthening the overlay/contrast behind all headline and body text elements. Increase the darkness/opacity of the background overlay so that the hero image does not bleed through and reduce text legibility. Ensure the heading, subheading, and paragraph text all meet strong contrast ratios against the hero background image.

quotes: the text on top of the hero image at the top is hard to read

acceptanceCriteria: All text in the hero section (name headline, bio paragraph, CTA button labels) is clearly legible against the background image
The hero background overlay is sufficiently dark/opaque to ensure high contrast for all text
The hero image is still visible but does not compete with text readability

requirements.text: Remove the jumping/animated scrolling text element from the hero section. Any animated text that bounces, jumps, or loops as a scroll indicator or decorative element should be removed or replaced with a static, non-animated alternative if a scroll cue is still desired.

quotes: the jumping scroll text is distracting

acceptanceCriteria: No text in the hero section has a jumping, bouncing, or looping animation
The hero section feels calm and readable without distracting motion
If a scroll-down cue remains, it is subtle and non-animated (or uses a gentle single fade rather than a repeating jump)

constraints: Do not alter the hero background image itself
Do not change the content or copy of the hero section
Do not modify any immutable frontend paths
nonGoals: Redesigning the overall hero section layout
Changing the hero section copy or structure
Modifying any other section of the page
